origins.background: Started in 1940s as an impromptu food fight during a town parade.

activities.title: Tomato fight
activities.description: One-hour controlled tomato throwing in the town center.

activities.title: Parade
activities.description: Festive floats and music through the main streets before the main event.

origins.background: Developed from Shetland Yule traditions and 19th-century torchlight processions.

activities.title: Torchlight procession
activities.description: Guizers march with flaming torches in Viking-inspired dress.

activities.title: Galley burning
activities.description: Replica Viking longship is burned at night with choral singing.

origins.background: Masked end-of-winter celebration with South Slavic roots.

activities.title: Mask carving
activities.description: Locals wear wooden horned masks and sheepskin outfits.

activities.title: Bonfire parade
activities.description: Procession ends with a bonfire symbolizing the burning of winter.

origins.background: Pre-Christian solstice rites blended with St. John the Baptist feast.

activities.title: Bonfires
activities.description: Lakeside bonfires at midnight sun to celebrate the solstice.

activities.title: Sauna and lake swims
activities.description: Families combine sauna with cold-water plunges and gatherings.

origins.background: Alpine folk tradition pairing St. Nicholas with the Krampus figure.

activities.title: Krampuslauf
activities.description: Costumed processions with bells and carved demonic masks.

activities.title: House visits
activities.description: St. Nicholas and Krampus visit homes to reward or frighten children.
